content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is how you can solve this problem in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the `filter` function to iterate over each word in the list. The `filter` function applies a condition (in this case, whether the first character of the word is a capital letter) and keeps only those elements that satisfy the condition. 

The `uppercase(x[1])` part checks if the first character of the string is uppercase. If it is, then `filter` will keep the word; otherwise, it will discard it.
